Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: おじいさん
Entry.EnglishText: Old Man

Entry.JapaneseText: notice
Entry.EnglishText: Notice

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギア兵
Entry.EnglishText: Callegean Soldier

Entry.JapaneseText: ノルゼン
Entry.EnglishText: Nolzen

Entry.JapaneseText: ノルゼン・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Nolzen - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: うるさくてこのままでは 夜も眠れんわっ！
Entry.EnglishText: How's anyone supposed to sleep with all this racket!

Entry.JapaneseText: いや……別にあんたらが 悪いわけじゃないがな……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Not that you guys have anything to do with it.

Entry.JapaneseText: 伝記なら、子供たちの寝物語の 参考にと思って借りたぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: If you're looking for the biography, I've been reading it to inspire the bedtime stories I tell the kiddos.
Entry.Notes: Im unsure about this one Gator/Dragon

Entry.JapaneseText: もう返却日を過ぎてたのか。 遠路はるばるごくろうさん。
Entry.EnglishText: I hadn't the foggiest clue that it was past due. I admire your diligence.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『伝記』を回収しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You got back the Biography.
Entry.Notes: I have no idea what this item's supposed to be

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、ヒューマじゃの ガジュマじゃのと種族の事で、 みんなギスギスしとる。 まったくバカバカしい……
Entry.EnglishText: Folks have been on edge lately, all "Huma this" and "Gajuma that" talk. Buncha nincompoops...

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近の若い奴らは、すぐに 人の意見に流される…… だから、すぐに種族だの 何だの大騒ぎするんじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: Young people these days get easily swept up by others opinions... And then they get caught up in all this hullabaloo about race...

Entry.JapaneseText: まったく…… 本を読まんからじゃ…… 本を読め、本を……
Entry.EnglishText: It's on account of them not readin' any books...! It's just not right...

Entry.JapaneseText: 種族だの何だの…… 相手の事を知ろうともせんで、 文句ばかり言いおって……
Entry.EnglishText: Everything's all about race these days... They just want to complain about others without getting to know them.

Entry.JapaneseText: ケンカするヒマがあったら 本を読んで、勉強すれば いいんじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: If they got time to pick fights, they got time to read and learn...

Entry.JapaneseText: どちらの種族が優れているのか、 そんな事を言い合っておるうちに 大ゲンカになったそうじゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: Apparently there was an argument over which race is superior which led to a large fight.

Entry.JapaneseText: 違いを比べるではなく、 違いを認め合って互いに 協力する事がなぜできん！
Entry.EnglishText: Maybe we should acknowledge our differences and accept one another instead of fighting over them!

Entry.JapaneseText: とうとう街の馬鹿者たちが 種族に分かれて大ゲンカを しおったわ……！
Entry.EnglishText: The fools in this city broke out into a huge fight over racial lines!

Entry.JapaneseText: 幸いにもケガ人だけで済んだが、 死人が出たらそれこそケンカでは 済まなくなるぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: Thankfully the worst thing to come out of it were injuries. I shudder to think of what would happen had someone died!

Entry.JapaneseText: バイラスが大暴れしたそうじゃが、 バイラスがヒューマとガジュマを 区別したか！
Entry.EnglishText: It seems the Biruses went on a rampage through town. Did they distinguish between Huma and Gajuma?

Entry.JapaneseText: 街の馬鹿者どもには、 そこんところを、よく 考えて欲しいもんじゃ！
Entry.EnglishText: Perhaps the fools who live here should take that into consideration!

Entry.JapaneseText: おお、あんたはその若さで、 医者の心得があるとな！ 感心じゃな！
Entry.EnglishText: Ohh, I see you've got a good understanding of medicine despite being so young! If only everyone were so studious!

Entry.JapaneseText: まさかとは思うが、 種族を区別して治療をする…… なんて事はなさそうじゃな！
Entry.EnglishText: I don't suppose you treat your patients differently based upon their race...? Ah, of course you don't!

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたは…… まあまあ本を読んどる顔をしとる。 ただ、年の割には苦労が多そうじゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: Hrmm... You've a well-read look to you. But you've encountered many hardships for someone your age.

Entry.JapaneseText: あまり固い本ばかりでなく、 たまには軽めの本も読んだほうが、 若者らしくてよいぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: Perhaps try a book on a lighter topic for once. Revel in your youth!

Entry.JapaneseText: そちらのお嬢さんと比べて、 おまえさんたちは抜けた顔を しとる！
Entry.EnglishText: Unlike that young lady, you look like you've never even seen a book!

Entry.JapaneseText: あまり本を読んでないな!? せめて、一ヶ月に一冊は 本を読め！
Entry.EnglishText: When was the last time you read anything?! At the very least you should be reading once per month!

Entry.JapaneseText: ううむ……ほんの少しだけ 街が落ち着いたようじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: Hrm... The city seems to have settled down just a tad.

Entry.JapaneseText: おまえさんたちのおかげかも しれんな……
Entry.EnglishText: Did you have anything to do with that...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 世の中の変りようといい…… スカラベの件といい…… 一体、何がどうしたというんじゃ！
Entry.EnglishText: These changes in society... The Scarabe incident... I can't make heads or tails of it!

Entry.JapaneseText: こればっかりは、 本には書いてない……
Entry.EnglishText: Nothing like this was ever in any book...

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサスでの事件の首謀者は あのスカラベらしいが…… あの馬鹿者が！
Entry.EnglishText: I've heard it was Scarabe who caused everything in Belsas. What a blasted fool!

Entry.JapaneseText: あいつとは古くからの知り合いじゃが、 あんな事をするほど馬鹿でも、 ガジュマ嫌いでもなかったはずじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: He was an acquaintance long ago, and I never knew him to be someone who would do such a thing, or grow to hate Gajuma so much...

Entry.JapaneseText: 演説の話を聞いて以来、 ガジュマたちはいつも 興奮しとるように見える……
Entry.EnglishText: The Gajuma seem to be perpetually agitated, ever since that speech...

Entry.JapaneseText: いまに大変な事が起こる…… 止める手立てはないのか……
Entry.EnglishText: I fear something terrible is afoot... Could there be any way to prevent it...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ジルバとかいう国のえらいさんが、 ガジュマを守るとか何とか、 都で演説をぶったそうじゃな！
Entry.EnglishText: Some haughty beaurocrat named Zilva gave a speech in the capital about protecting Gajuma!

Entry.JapaneseText: 全く、何を考えとるんじゃ！ 種族の争いが起きとる時に、 それをあおるような事を言うとは、 それが国のやる事か！
Entry.EnglishText: What are they trying to achieve? Is sowing further discord when tensions are already high really what our government should do?!

Entry.JapaneseText: ジルバという女…… 本を読んどらんな……！
Entry.EnglishText: That Zilva woman... I bet she doesn't read...!

Entry.JapaneseText: わしは本を読んどるぞ！ このおかしな世の中を直す 方法を知るためにな！
Entry.EnglishText: This is precisely why I read! To figure out some way to fix this out of control world!

Entry.JapaneseText: おまえさんたちも本を読め！ いいな、本を読むんじゃぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: You all had better start reading too! You hear me?

Entry.JapaneseText: わしは本を読んどるぞ！ このおかしな世の中を直す 方法を知るためにな！
Entry.EnglishText: This is precisely why I read! To figure out some way to fix this out of control world!

Entry.JapaneseText: 本を読め！ もっと本を！
Entry.EnglishText: Read, I say! Read all the books!

Entry.JapaneseText: それがいずれ、 血となり、肉となるのじゃ！
Entry.EnglishText: Read until it becomes your very flesh and blood!

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近もの忘れが激しくてな。 思い出したい言葉があるのじゃが、 どうしても出てこんのじゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: I've found myself forgetting things quite often as of late. I can't find the right words when it comes time to speak them.

Entry.JapaneseText: 頭の文字はわかっとるんじゃが、 あとがさっぱりで……
Entry.EnglishText: I can think of the first letter, but the rest never follows...

Entry.JapaneseText: 辞典でもあれば、調べる事が できるんじゃがなぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: If only I had a dictionary to consult at such times...

Entry.JapaneseText: なに？ 辞典を 貸してくれるのか？
Entry.EnglishText: What's that? You just so happen to have a dictionary you'd be willing to lend?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『辞典』を貸し出しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You lent the Dictionary.

Entry.JapaneseText: おお！ ありがたい。 これで調べる事ができるわい。
Entry.EnglishText: You have my thanks! Now I can finally remember what I was trying to say.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんじゃ、 違うのか……
Entry.EnglishText: Hrm? No, that wasn't it...

Entry.JapaneseText: やっと思い出す事が できたんじゃよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Aha, I've remembered at last!

Entry.JapaneseText: おかげで胸のつかえが おりたわい。 ありがとうな。
Entry.EnglishText: Thanks to you, I've finally gotten that off my chest.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『辞典』を回収しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You got back the Dictionary.

Entry.JapaneseText: わしが言いたかったのは 「かくしゃく」じゃった。
Entry.EnglishText: The word I was looking for was "spry!"

Entry.JapaneseText: まだまだ若いもんには 負けんぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: I've still got some kick left in me!

Entry.JapaneseText: うーむ。 「か」で始まるのは 確かなんじゃが……
Entry.EnglishText: Hrm... I was certain it started with an "s"...

Entry.JapaneseText: なかなか見つからんな。 すまんが、もうしばらく 貸しておいてくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: This might take me some time still, so I'd like to hold on to this a bit longer.

Entry.JapaneseText: 「かくしゃく」とは 年をとっても丈夫で元気な事じゃ。 人生まだまだこれからじゃよ。
Entry.EnglishText: "Spry" is used to describe someone full of energy, especially an older person. I've still got plenty of life left to live.

Entry.JapaneseText: あと少しの辛抱です。 今、手当てしますからね。
Entry.EnglishText: I need you to bear with me for a moment. I am going to administer treatment, okay?

Entry.JapaneseText: 具合はどうですか？
Entry.EnglishText: How are you feeling?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……楽になった気がする。 ありがとう……先生……
Entry.EnglishText: I feel much more at ease. Thank you...doctor...

Entry.JapaneseText: 先生……
Entry.EnglishText: "Doctor..."

Entry.JapaneseText: 先生、ありがとよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you, doctor.

Entry.JapaneseText: だいぶ痛みも取れたよ…… あんたのお仲間のおかげだな。
Entry.EnglishText: It hardly hurts at all now, thanks to your friend there.
Entry.Notes: assuming this isn't directly connected to the previous box, otherwise things would need to be changed

Entry.JapaneseText: オ、オレはいいから…… 他の仲間を助けてやって くれ……
Entry.EnglishText: Don't worry about me, help the others...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『海賊の鉄カブト』 この家に昔から伝わっている 海賊の鉄カブト。角は鋼鉄製。 おしゃれでかぶるには重すぎる。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Steel Pirate Helm - A helmet adorned with steel horns that has been passed down through the generations. Though it does look stylish, it weighs too much to be practical to wear.
Entry.Notes: this description relies heavily on what the actual thing looks like, so some details might not be quite right

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『木箱』 中には固形燃料が入っている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Wooden Crate - Solid fuel is packed within.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『木箱の中身』 小さくて長持ちする炭。 煙も少なくて安全。 ノルゼンの生活必需品。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Wooden Crate's Contents - It's full of small, long-lasting charcoals that are safer due to producing less smoke. You can't live in Nolzen without them.
Entry.Notes: maybe 'opened crate'? again, hard to tell without a visual reference
